title: ECCV_2016_110_abs

sentences.text: Recent progress in computer vision has been driven by high-capacity models trained on large datasets .
Unfortunately , creating large datasets with pixel-level labels has been extremely costly due to the amount of human effort required .
In this paper , we present an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps for images extracted from modern computer games .

summary: Recent progress in computer vision has been driven by high-capacity models trained on large datasets . Unfortunately , creating large datasets with pixel-level labels has been extremely costly due to the amount of human effort required . In this paper , we present an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps for images extracted from modern computer games .

Predicate-has_been_driven_by.label: has been driven by
Predicate-has_been_driven_by.description: Indicates that a subject's development or evolution was influenced or guided by an object. The predicate suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the object played a significant role in shaping or directing the subject's progress.

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' indicates a necessary condition or prerequisite for achieving or accomplishing something. It implies that the subject needs to have or possess the object in order to successfully complete its task, fulfill its purpose, or reach its goal.

Predicate-has_been_extremely_costly_due_.label: has been extremely costly due to
Predicate-has_been_extremely_costly_due_.description: This predicate indicates that a process or activity (subject) has incurred significant expenses or expenditures as a direct result of some underlying factor or circumstance (object). The object typically represents the root cause or contributing factor behind the high costs, and the predicate highlights the causal relationship between them.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that a subject (an idea, concept, or work) exists and is being shared or offered to others. It implies a sense of availability, accessibility, or exposure, connecting the subject to an object (such as a paper, report, or document), which provides more information about the subject.

Predicate-extracted_from.label: extracted from
Predicate-extracted_from.description: The predicate 'extracted from' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. images) has been obtained or derived from the object (e.g. modern computer games). It suggests that the subject's content, characteristics, or features are somehow related to or originated from the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: To present means to introduce or offer something, such as a concept, idea, method, or solution. In this context, it indicates that the subject provides or offers the object as a contribution, explanation, or proposal.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. It establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is a narrower or more detailed version of the object.
